channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On boundary extension of unclosed Orlicz-Sobolev mappings
item.description: arXiv:2504.18123v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper is devoted to the study of the boundary behavior of Orlicz-Sobolev classes that may not preserve the boundary under mapping. Under certain conditions, we show that these mappings have a continuous extension to the boundary of definition domain.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Desyatka, Evgeny Sevost'yanov

item.title: A non-algebraizable foliation
item.description: arXiv:2504.18472v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: It is presented an example of a holomorphic foliation of a non-algebraizable surface which is topologically equivalent to an algebraic foliation.
item.dc:creator: Paulo Sad

item.title: Exponential approximation and meromorphic interpolation
item.description: arXiv:2412.20224v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We establish a relation between the approximation in $L^2[-\pi,\pi]$ by exponentials with the set of frequencies of Beurling--Malliavin density less than $1$ and the meromorphic interpolation at $\mathbb Z$. Furthermore, we show that typical $L^2[-\pi,\pi]$ functions admit such an approximation.
item.dc:creator: Yurii Belov, Alexander Borichev, Alexander Kuznetsov

item.title: Affine vs. Stein in rigid geometry
item.description: arXiv:2305.08974v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We investigate the relationship between affine and Stein varieties in the context of rigid geometry. We show that the two concepts are much more closely related than in complex geometry, e.g. they are equivalent for surfaces. This rests on the density of algebraic functions in analytic functions. One key ingredient to prove such a density statement is an extension result for Cartier divisors.
item.dc:creator: Marco Maculan, J\'er\^ome Poineau

item.title: On solutions to $-\Delta u = V u$ near infinity
item.description: arXiv:2401.05242v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We investigate the unique continuation property and the sign changing behavior of weak solutions to $-\Delta u =Vu$ near infinity under certain conditions on the blow-up rate of the potential $V$ near infinity.
item.dc:creator: Yifei Pan, Yuan Zhang
